snippet: Eliot Spitzer has spent more than $2.5 million since announcing his candidacy, compared with the $173,000 that Scott M. Stringer reported in the most recent filing period.
abstract: Eliot Spitzer is drastically outspending opponent Scott M Stringer in race for New York City comptroller, spending more than $2.5 million since announcing his candidacy; Stringer, who is participating in city's public matching funds program, has accused Spitzer of trying to buy his way back into public office.
lead_paragraph: Eliot Spitzer has spent more than $2.5 million since announcing his candidacy, compared with the $173,000 that Scott M. Stringer reported in the most recent filing period.

headline.main: In Comptroller’s Race, Spitzer Dwarfs Stringer in Spending
headline.print_headline: In Comptroller’s Race, Spitzer Dwarfs Stringer in Spending
